cards.helpDesc: We raise funds and organise activities to truly help children and people in need.
cards.businessDesc: We connect companies and people, creating networking and cooperation space.
cards.communityDesc: We build relationships, organise events and connect Poles in Barcelona and surroundings.
cards.cultureDesc: We showcase Polish culture and values, co-creating Barcelona's colourful mosaic.

finalSection.title: 34th WOÅšP Finale â€” Healthy tummies for our kids

contactSection.title: Contact us
contactSection.description: Do you have questions, want to become a sponsor or volunteer? Write to us!

about.title: About us
about.mission: Our mission is to help children and seniors through the organization of charity events in Barcelona.
about.history: We have been supporting the Great Orchestra of Christmas Charity for 9 years, raising funds for the most important goals.

missionCards.title: Supporting those most in need
missionCards.description: We raise funds and organize actions to help the most vulnerable children and elderly. Every zloty goes directly to Polish hospitals for the purchase of modern medical equipment.

missionCards.title: Supporting local businesses
missionCards.description: We connect companies and people, creating space for cooperation. Our partners include Polish companies in Catalonia and local entrepreneurs who want to help and reach new audiences.

missionCards.title: Integration of the Polish community
missionCards.description: We build relationships and organize events that connect Poles in and around Barcelona. It's a meeting place for newcomers, students, and anyone looking for Polish connections.

missionCards.title: Promoting Polish culture in Spain
missionCards.description: We showcase the beauty of Polish culture, art, and traditions. During our finals, we host artists from Poland, and participants can taste Polish cuisine and drinks. Every year, more and more Poles, Catalans, and people from around the world come to experience 'Cultura Polaca' at our final event.

wospHistory.title: History of WOÅšP
wospHistory.content: The Great Orchestra of Christmas Charity (WOÅšP) is the largest charity organization in Poland, founded in 1993 by Jerzy Owsiak. Over 30 years of activity, it has raised over 2 billion zloty for medical purposes.
wospHistory.events: Every January, WOÅšP Finals take place across Poland and around the world â€“ the largest charity events that unite millions of people for one goal: saving the lives and health of children and the elderly.

medicalGoals.title: Medical Goals
medicalGoals.content: WOÅšP finances the purchase of the most modern medical equipment for Polish hospitals. Each year has its specific medical goal â€“ from pediatric cardiac surgery, through oncology, to geriatrics.
medicalGoals.impact: Thanks to WOÅšP, Polish hospitals have received thousands of devices: from ventilators, through CT scanners, to modern operating rooms. This is tangible help that saves lives every day.

jurek.title: Jerzy Owsiak and the Foundation
jurek.content: Jerzy Owsiak, founder and president of the WOÅšP Foundation, is one of the most recognizable figures in Polish social life. A journalist, social activist, and visionary who for decades has been building a social movement based on kindness and help.
jurek.transparency: The WOÅšP Foundation operates transparently â€“ every zloty is accounted for publicly. It's an organization that has changed the face of Polish pediatric and geriatric medicine, equipping hospitals with billions of zloty worth of equipment.

barcelonaSection.title: WOÅšP Barcelona
barcelonaSection.subtitle: For over 9 years we have been building in Barcelona a unique place where Polish energy and Spanish temperament unite to help.

paragraphs.season1: The WOÅšP season runs from early December to the end of January â€“ these are the two most intense months of the year. During this time, we set up our team and meet regularly with the same core group of people.
paragraphs.season2: After the Finale, usually in February, our team disbands and a new one is formed each year. That's why you might not hear much from us between February and November â€“ that's when we return to our families and daily routines.
paragraphs.season3: We often organize internal volunteer meetings during this time to discuss what worked well that year and what we can improve.
paragraphs.volunteers1: We have volunteers who have been with us for years, but we also welcome new people who have just moved to the area and are looking to connect with the Polish community.
paragraphs.volunteers2: We invite students who often help us as part of their internships, which is very helpful during the Finale organization. We welcome all help â€“ even one-time assistance!
paragraphs.volunteers3: We encourage everyone who wants to help, make new friends, or simply be part of the volunteer community to join us.
paragraphs.partners1: We collaborate with many Polish and local Catalan companies. Our main partner, World Class Barcelona, started with WOÅšP in Barcelona and now focuses on developing their Spanish language school, but they always support us!
paragraphs.partners2: Another key partner is Kosmo Hispano â€“ a Polish language school for children that helps us organizationally and always organizes various events for children, like Christmas and St. Andrew's Day parties.
paragraphs.partners3: We often meet at the Krakoviak restaurant, which is another one of our main sponsors and supports us from the kitchen!
paragraphs.partners4: All the funds we raise come from sponsors â€“ mostly local ones. We don't have our own funds â€“ everything we have comes from sponsors. We're very grateful to them because without them, the Finales wouldn't happen!

final33Section.title: 33rd WOÅšP Finale in Barcelona
final33Section.intro: In January 2025 we organised the 33rd WOÅšP Finale in Barcelona. It was our best Finale so far!
final33Section.medicalDesc: The 33rd Finale was dedicated to palliative and hospice medicine. The funds raised were used to purchase medical equipment that helps ensure a dignified life and death for patients in their most difficult moments.
final33Section.photoCreditThanks: Thank you for capturing the wonderful moments from our 33rd Finale!

page.subtitle: Join our charity events and help with us. Every event is an opportunity to help and have a great time!

7.title: Online Volunteer Meeting
7.description: Online meeting for WOÅšP Barcelona volunteers. Contact us through the contact form to receive the meeting link.
7.fullDescription:
We invite you to an online meeting for WOÅšP Barcelona volunteers! It's an excellent opportunity for those who cannot attend the in-person meeting.

During the online meeting:
â€¢ You will meet the WOÅšP Barcelona organizing team
â€¢ You will learn about current plans for the 34th Finale
â€¢ You can ask questions and express your ideas
â€¢ You will receive access to informational materials
â€¢ You will meet other volunteers from all over Catalonia

ğŸ“ HOW TO JOIN:
To receive the meeting link, contact us through the contact form on the website. We will send you the meeting details and the platform link.

It's the ideal option for people who:
â€¢ Live far from the center of Barcelona
â€¢ Have limited time
â€¢ Prefer online participation
â€¢ Want to join the volunteer team

The meeting will be held on an online platform - you will receive details after contacting us.

8.fullDescription:

We invite you to a WOÅšP Barcelona volunteer meeting at Wawel Restobar â€” our main sponsor! It's the perfect place to get to know each other, chat and enjoy delicious Polish food and drinks straight from Poland.

1.title: 34th WOÅšP Finale in Barcelona
1.description: ğŸ‰ The biggest charity event of the year in Barcelona! Join us at Espacio 88 for a day full of workshops, performances, auctions and integration. We play for healthy tummies of Polish children!

sponsors.title: Sponsors
sponsors.description: Together we create good! This page presents the companies and institutions that support WOÅšP Barcelona. Thank you for every form of help.

cta.title: Want to become a sponsor or partner?
cta.subtitle: Get in touch â€“ we will prepare a tailored collaboration proposal.

sponsors.title: Sponsors
sponsors.description: Companies that financially support our activities and enable the organization of WOÅšP events in Barcelona.

partners.title: Partners
partners.description: Local companies and institutions that support our activities logistically, substantively and organizationally.

coorganizers.title: Co-organizers
coorganizers.description: Organizations and individuals who co-create and carry out the WOÅšP mission in Barcelona together with us.

bonaBarcelona.name: Bona Barcelona
bonaBarcelona.description: Charity auction sponsor. Provides vouchers for trips: Montserrat for 6 people (â‚¬480) and Andorra for 6 people (â‚¬1020). Vouchers valid for one year.

wawelRestobar.name: Wawel RestoBar
wawelRestobar.description: Polish restaurant in Barcelona. A little piece of Poland in the heart of Barcelona. Here you can order perfectly prepared pierogi, soup and sausages. The chefs prepare delicious pancakes, apple pie and other Polish specialties. According to guests, the beer tastes excellent here.

solDeGracia.name: Sol de Gracia
solDeGracia.description: The best craft beer shop in Barcelona. Sol de Gracia is a craft beer shop with the largest selection in all of Barcelona. Come choose your favorite beer, we guarantee that if we don't have it, it probably doesn't exist.

kosmoHisplano.name: Kosmo HisPLano Educational Association
kosmoHisplano.description: Invites the youngest residents of Barcelona, especially children and youth from Polish families, to participate in exciting extracurricular activities. The organization focuses on enriching language skills and expanding knowledge about Poland.

donate.title: Donate Online
donate.subtitle: We will soon launch an online fundraiser for the 34th WOÅšP Finale.
donate.goalDescription: We play to support the diagnosis and treatment of gastrointestinal diseases in the youngest patients. This is real support for approximately 1.2â€“1.5 million children suffering from gastroenterological conditions.
donate.whyImportantText1: Pediatric gastroenterology in Poland faces a growing number of patients and the need for modern equipment that improves diagnostic and treatment outcomes, including in surgery.
donate.whyImportantText2: Gastrointestinal diseases in children (e.g., celiac disease, Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis, GERD, severe food allergies, pancreatic and liver diseases) and nutritional disorders (malnutrition and obesity) are increasingly common and affect the development, immunity, and daily functioning of the youngest.
donate.collectionTitle: The fundraiser has not started yet
donate.collectionText: We are not yet collecting donations for the 34th WOÅšP Finale. We will start accepting donations in December.
